skills.name: Describe the properties of an isosceles triangle
Describe the properties of a scalene triangle
Identifying acute, obtuse and right triangles

explanations.A: Scalene means none of the sides or angles of the triangle are equal, but the angles can all be acute. Do any of these names tell us that the triangle has an angle that isn't acute?
explanations.B: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be acute or obtuse so it could be an acute triangle. Do any of these names tell us that the triangle has an angle that isn't acute?
explanations.C: A right triangle has an angle that is 90 degrees, so the angles cannot all be acute.
explanations.D: An equilateral triangle has all equal sides and angles, so each angle is 60 degrees and therefore acute. Do any of these names tell us that the triangle has an angle that isn't acute?

explanations.A: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be obtuse. Try drawing out isosceles and equilateral triangles with an obtuse angle, can you do it?
explanations.B: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be obtuse so it could be an obtuse triangle. Try drawing out scalene and equilateral triangles with an obtuse angle, can you do it?
explanations.C: An equilateral triangle has all equal angles, so each angle is 60 degrees and therefore acute therefore an equilateral triangle can never be obtuse!
explanations.D: These are the two types of triangles that can be obtuse... Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be obtuse. Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be obtuse.

explanations.A: An obtuse triangle needs one obtuse angle, but in a right triangle we always have two acute angles and a right angle. Can you picture any of these triangles with an angle bigger than 90 degrees?
explanations.B: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but if we have two 45 degree angles the third angle is a right angle, making it a right isosceles triangle.
explanations.C: An acute triangle has all acute angles, so none of them can be a right angle to make it a right triangle. Can you picture any of these triangles with a right angle?
explanations.D: An equilateral triangle has all equal sides and angles, so each angle is 60 degrees. Can you picture an of these triangles with a right angle?

explanations.A: An equilateral triangle has all equal sides and angles... What is the size of each angle? So what type of triangle is this?
explanations.B: An isosceles triangle has two equal angles whereas an equilateral triangle has three equal angles... What is the size of each angle? So what type of triangle is this?
explanations.C: An equilateral triangle has all equal angles, therefore each angle is 60 degrees. 60 degrees is an acute angle therefore an equilateral triangle is a type of acute triangle!
explanations.D: An equilateral triangle has all equal sides and angles... What is the size of each angle? So what type of triangle is this?

explanations.A: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be acute or obtuse so it could be an obtuse triangle. Which of these triangles cannot have two equal angles?
explanations.B: Scalene means none of the sides or angles of the triangle are equal, but isosceles means two sides are equal, so a triangle cannot be both.
explanations.C: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be acute or obtuse so it could be an acute triangle. Which of these triangles cannot have two equal angles?
explanations.D: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but if we have two 45 degree angles the third angle is a right angle, making it a right isosceles triangle. Which of these triangles cannot have two equal angles?

explanations.A: An acute triangle has three angles all less than 90 degrees, because a right triangle has to have an angle of 90 degrees it can never be acute!
explanations.B: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be a right angle. Try drawing out acute and isosceles triangles with a right angle, can you do it?
explanations.C: Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be a right angle. Try drawing out scalene and acute triangles with a right angle, can you do it?
explanations.D: These are the two types of triangles that can be right triangles... Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be a right angle. Isosceles means two of the angles of the triangle are equal, but the third angle can be a right angle.

explanations.A: A 60 degree angle is acute, so the triangle could be acute, but is that the only possibility?
explanations.B: The triangle could be obtuse, for example if the angles were 60, 100, 20, but is that the only possibility?
explanations.C: The triangle could be right if the angles were 60, 90, 30, but is that the only possible type of triangle with a 60 degree angle?
explanations.D: If one angle in a triangle is 60, the others could be both acute, one acute and one obtuse, or one acute and one right, so all these triangle types are possible.

explanations.A: An isosceles triangle does have two equal angles but check what the value of the third angle would be for this specific triangle...
explanations.B: 60 + 60 = 120 degrees so the third angle will need to be less than 90 as well (acute) to make this triangle work so it can't be obtuse! Try work out the value of the third angle, what do you notice?
explanations.C: To be a right triangle we need an angle of 90 degrees.. 60 + 60 + 90 = 210 degrees which is too many! Try work out the value of the third angle, what do you notice?
explanations.D: Let's work out the third angle, if the other two angles are 60 degrees... 180 - 60 - 60 = 60 therefore the third angle is also 60 degrees. If all the angles are the same this is an equilateral triangle!

explanations.A: Scalene means none of the sides or angles of the triangle are equal, but isosceles means two sides are equal, so a triangle cannot be both. Which of these triangles can have no equal sides or angles?
explanations.B: Equilateral means all the sides and angles are equal, but scalene means none of them are equal, so a triangle cannot be both. Which of these triangles could have three different angles?
explanations.C: A scalene triangle has no equal angles. A right triangle has one 90 degree angle, but the other two can be any angles that add up to 90, so we can have a scalene right triangle.
explanations.D: A scalene triangle has no equal angles. One of these triangles could have three different angles, which one is it?

explanations.A: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but all of the angles can be acute. Try drawing out obtuse and right triangles with three different sized angles, is it possible?
explanations.B: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be obtuse. Try drawing out acute and right triangles with three different sized angles, is it possible?
explanations.C: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal, but one of the angles can be a right angle. Try drawing out acute and obtuse triangles with three different sized angles, is it possible?
explanations.D: Scalene means none of the angles of the triangle are equal... You can draw scalene triangles with all acute angles, one obtuse angle or a right angle therefore a scalene triangle can be all three types of triangle!
